did.unittitle: University of Connecticut, Computing Committee Records

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence, clippings, administrative reporting, committe proceedings, notes, fliers (handouts), and publications related to the Computing Committee and their involvement in UCINFO. Among the subjects discussed in the collection is the Campus Wide Information System (CWIS), UCINFO content, committee policies, goals, guides, training, and the transition from Gopher and Mole to the World Wide Web.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: On January 17, 1994, the University of Connecticut began operating a University-wide online public information system known as UCINFO. UCINFO was the result of a cooperative effort by the University Computer Center and the Homer Babbidge Library, and aided through the support from the University Computing Committee. UCINFO provided public information about UConn for use by the UConn community, as well as the public seeking information about the university.

UCINFO was a university initiative to provide online public information, and was designed to make a broad range of information about UConn activities, events, and programs readily accessible to the public. The information came from a number of sources, to include UConn press releases, the student union master calendar of events, and academic and administrative departments. It was a mainframe-based system with two major components: HUSKY MOLE and HUSKY GOPHER.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, clippings, administrative reporting, committe proceedings, notes, fliers (handouts), and publications related to the University Computing Committee and their support of UCINFO. Among the subjects discussed in the collection is the Campus Wide Information System (CWIS), UCINFO content, committee policies, goals, guides, training, and the transition from Gopher and Mole to the World Wide Web. The collection contains materials from the planning stages of UCINFO in 1993 as well as materials associated with its operation through 1996.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were donated to the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center in 1998.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], University of Connecticut, Computing Committee Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students, etc.]. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: Campus Wide Information System (CWIS) - deliver information about university electronically, Membership, Proceedings, UCINFO Content, Policies, Goals, Guides, Training, Transition from Gopher and Mole to World Wide Web.]
